project-01.title: air traffic simulator
project-01.description: discover the air traffic simulator, a java console application for simulating airports, flights, and realistic plane movements with conflict resolution.
project-01.subtitle: console application

content.part-01: a simple console application written in the java, implemented as a library of classes representing air traffic simulation.
content.part-02: here you can build a miniature world of airports and flights, explore their connections on a map, and watch a live simulation of planes taking off, flying, and landing with realistic timing and smart handling of conflicts and errors.

project-01.remark: the full text version of the tasks can be found in the github repository.

project-02.title: big decimal
project-02.description: explore the big decimal c++ library for handling large decimal numbers with unlimited precision and accuracy.
project-02.subtitle: console application

content.part-01: a simple console application written in the c++, implemented as a static library of classes representing large decimals numbers.
content.part-02: the big decimal class represents an abstract data type for working with signed large numbers. large integers have an unlimited number of digits for the integer and fractional parts. all operations are performed with unlimited accuracy.

project-02.remark: it was not allowed to use collections from standard libraries, but exclusively built-in and own data types and structures or to use libraries that implement similar or the same functionality. the full text version of the tasks can be found in the github repository.

project-03.title: cli
project-03.description: learn about the CLI c++ application, a command line interpreter with input/output redirection and piping features.
project-03.subtitle: console application

content.part-01: a simple console application written in the c++, implemented as a library of classes representing basic command line interface.
content.part-02: command line interpreter (cli) reads commands one at a time and executes them. commands can be entered interactively or from a batch file. the interpreter supports basic operating system features such as input/output redirection and piping, providing a simplified version of a real command line interface.

project-03.remark: the full text version of the tasks can be found in the github repository.

project-04.title: collect coins
project-04.description: play collect coins, a java arcade game where you control a character to collect coins as fast as possible.
project-04.subtitle: video game

content.part-01: a simple arcade game created in java awt library. in this game, the player controls a character on the screen with the w-a-s-d keys. the objective of the game is to collect all the coins in the least amount of time. coins will be randomly placed on the screen, and the player can collect them by moving the character over them.
content.part-02: overall, a 'collect coins' game in java involved creating a gui, handling user input, designing the game logic, and implementing game mechanics such as trivial collision detection and scorekeeping.

project-05.title: exam scheduling
project-05.description: discover the exam scheduling in python, a constraint satisfaction based application for scheduling university exams in halls.
project-05.subtitle: console application

content.part-01: a simple console application written in the python implementing a exam scheduling.
content.part-02: the purpose of the exam scheduling is to schedule exams of the school of electrical engineering, university of belgrade, within one examination period. the system distributes the exams by halls in the free ones terms so that all introduced restrictions are respected. the result exam placement is one of potentially more possible schedule, which can be evaluated according to different criteria in depending on the rationality of using available resources.
content.part-03: the entities present in the exam scheduling are exams and halls.
content.part-04: the above system is implemented in such a way that its scheduling algorithm is based on the constraint satisfaction method. system based on input files with data on halls and exam dates, schedules all exams respecting the given restrictions. the following restrictions are implemented:
content.part-05: one exam occupies exactly one term and is held in the required number of halls. several different exams can be arranged in one term,
content.part-06: the number of assigned students in the hall cannot exceed the capacity of that hall,
content.part-07: exams start in one of the 4 times mentioned (08:00, 11:30, 15:00, 18:30), considering that no exam lasts longer than 3 hours,
content.part-08: only one exam can be held in one hall at a time,
content.part-09: exams that are taken on computers can only be assigned to the rooms they own computers.
content.part-10: the solution is implemented in python with permission to use all standard libraries and data structures, but not out-of-the-box csps algorithms. the full text version of the tasks can be found in the github repository.

project-05.remark: the solution is implemented in the python with permission to use all standard libraries and data structures, but not out-of-the-box csps algorithms. the full text version of the tasks can be found in the github repository.

project-06.title: flappy rocket
project-06.description: experience flappy rocket, an arcade game built with the Navia engine using lua, featuring a particle system.
project-06.subtitle: video game

content.part-01: a simple arcade game created in
content.part-03: engine as an test example of using a basic particle system.

project-06.remark: even though that engine utilises cmake for building at the moment, this project uses lua programming language and premake, because the game was created before the build system was changed.

project-07.title: loopa
project-07.description: discover Loopa simulator, a native application for interactive visualizations of complex dynamical systems like Lorenz attractors and RLC circuits.
project-07.subtitle: native application

content.part-01: loopa simulator ‚Äî interactive visualizations of complex dynamical systems
content.part-02: loopa simulator brings abstract math to life by turning complex dynamical systems into engaging, interactive visuals. explore chaotic patterns like the lorenz attractor or electrical oscillations in rlc circuits with intuitive visual feedback that makes tough concepts easier to grasp.
content.part-03: adjust system parameters instantly using simple sliders and watch how trajectories and stability change in real time. see animated paths and flow fields that reveal the underlying behavior of nonlinear dynamics. for higher-dimensional (3d+) systems, project dynamics onto 2d planes (xy, xz, yz) to uncover hidden structures and make advanced analysis accessible.
content.part-05: ‚Ä¢ students: visualize differential equations, nonlinear dynamics, and chaos theory
content.part-06: ‚Ä¢ educators: clearly demonstrate behaviors of complex systems in stem
content.part-07: ‚Ä¢ enthusiasts: explore fascinating patterns in science and technology
content.part-08: download loopa simulator and start your visual journey into dynamics today.

project-07.remark: these simulations are phase space ones - a way to visualize how the state of a dynamical system evolves over time. rather than plotting position vs. time or velocity vs. time like you might in a physics class, a phase space plot shows all possible states of a system and how the system moves through them.

project-08.subtitle: game engine

content.part-01: a simple 2d game engine created in c/c++. some of the technologies used are:

project-08.remark: the project utilises cmake for building, and it is still under development. at the moment, there is only support for windows operating system and opengl graphics api.
project-08.alt-04: p4. a simple game created in the engine

project-09.title: preemptive os kernel
project-09.description: explore the preemptive OS kernel, a console application implementing multithreading, semaphores, and time-sharing for RISC-V architecture.
project-09.subtitle: console application

content.part-01: a console application that represent a small, but fully functional kernel that supports multithreading with time sharing. in the following explanation, this type of system will be referred to as just kernel.
content.part-02: firstly, two things implemented are memory allocator and thread management system. kernel provides the concept of threads, semaphores and time-sharing support, as well as asynchronous context switching and preemption, on timer and keyboard interrupts.
content.part-03: the kernel is implemented as a library, so that the user program (application) and the kernel itself share the same address space, that is, they represent a statically linked single program preloaded into the computer's operating memory. competitive processes created within the application will actually be only "light" processes, i.e. threads run within the program. this configuration is typical for embedded systems, which do not execute arbitrary programs that are loaded and executed on demand user, they only execute the program (together with the operating system) that is already there built-in in the target hardware.

project-09.remark: the kernel is implemented for the risc v processor architecture and a school computer with this processor. the implemented kernel is executed in a virtual environment (a risc v processor emulator).

project-11.title: stock
project-11.description: check out the stock web application, a reactive app using Spring Framework to display real-time share prices and market movements.

privacy-policy.heading: privacy policy
privacy-policy.description: read the privacy policy of ilijaruzic.rs to understand how user data is collected, used, and protected on this website.
privacy-policy.intro-paragraph: this privacy policy explains how ilijaruzic.rs (‚Äúthe website‚Äù) handles user data. the website is operated by its owner, who is responsible for any personal data processed through it.
privacy-policy.data-text: the website uses certain cookies and browser technologies to enhance your experience and enable core functionality, including:
data-list: the ‚Äòtheme‚Äô cookie to manage light/dark mode
the ‚Äòcookie-consent‚Äô cookie to remember your preference
personal data (name and email), used only to respond to contact form inquiries, based on your consent
browser features such as the navigator.online property to detect network connectivity for functionality; this operates entirely on the client side and does not collect or transmit personal data
no-data-list: additional personal or usage data beyond what is necessary
your ip address, browser type, or device information for tracking or analytics
third-party social media data for login or profiling
privacy-policy.links-text: the site may link to external pages that i do not control. please review their privacy policies, as i am not responsible for their content or practices.
privacy-policy.changes-text: this policy may be updated from time to time; any revisions will appear on this page with a new ‚Äúlast updated‚Äù date.
privacy-policy.contact-text: you have the right to request access, correction, or deletion of your personal data, as well as restriction or objection to its processing, and the right to lodge a complaint with a relevant supervisory authority. personal data is retained only as long as necessary to respond to your inquiry. the website may be hosted by a third-party provider that processes limited technical data (such as IP addresses) for security and server operation purposes. for any privacy-related questions, contact me:

security-policy.heading: security policy
security-policy.description: learn about the security measures and policies implemented on ilijaruzic.rs to protect user data and ensure safe interactions.
security-policy.scope-intro: this security policy explains how ilijaruzic.rs (‚Äúthe website‚Äù) protects the site‚Äôs security and how you can report issues.
security-policy.data-collection-description: the website processes limited information strictly necessary for security and functionality, including:
data-collection-list: information voluntarily submitted through the contact form (name, email, message)
basic technical signals required for secure communication and proper site operation
security-policy.reporting-description: if you discover a security vulnerability, please report it responsibly by emailing detailed information. avoid public disclosure until the issue has been resolved.
security-policy.response-description: reports are typically acknowledged within 3 business days, and reasonable efforts are made to investigate and resolve confirmed issues.
security-policy.recommendations-description: please avoid sending highly sensitive information through unsecured channels and use standard internet security practices.
security-policy.disclaimer-text: while reasonable measures are taken to maintain security, no system can be guaranteed to be completely secure. use of the website is at your own risk.
security-policy.changes-text: this policy may be updated from time to time; any revisions will appear on this page with a new ‚Äúlast updated‚Äù date.
security-policy.contact-text: for security concerns or vulnerability reports, you can reach me:
